@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The label class brings typical text content to the widget system. It supports simple text nodes and complex HTML (rich). The default content mode is for text only. The mode is changeable through the property {@link #rich}. The label supports heightForWidth when used in HTML mode. This means that multi line HTML automatically computes the correct preferred height. Example Here is a little example of how to use the widget. 


   var label1 = new qx.ui.basic.Label("Simple text label");
   this.getRoot().add(label1, {left:20, top:10});

   var label2 = new qx.ui.basic.Label().set({
     value: "A long label text with auto-wrapping. This also may contain rich HTML markup.",
     rich : true,
     width: 120
   });
   this.getRoot().add(label2, {left:20, top:50});

The first label in this example is a basic text only label. As such no automatic wrapping is supported. The second label is a long label containing HTML markup with automatic line wrapping. External Documentation Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo manual. NOTE: Instances of this class must be disposed of after use

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {String} Text or HTML content to use
@param.description: Text or HTML content to use

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Switches between rich HTML and text content. The text mode (false) supports advanced features like ellipsis when the available space is not enough. HTML mode (true) supports multi-line content and all the markup features of HTML content.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Controls whether text wrap is activated or not. But please note, that this property works only in combination with the property {@link #rich}. The {@link #wrap} has only an effect if the {@link #rich} property is set to true, otherwise {@link #wrap} has no effect.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Controls whether line wrapping can occur in the middle of a word; this is typically only useful when there is a restricted amount of horizontal space and words would otherwise overflow beyond the width of the element. Words are typically considered as separated by spaces, so "abc/def/ghi" is a 11 character word that would not be split without breakWithWords set to true.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Contains the HTML or text content. Interpretation depends on the value of {@link #rich}. In text mode entities and other HTML special content is not supported. But it is possible to use unicode escape sequences to insert symbols and other non ASCII characters.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The buddy property can be used to connect the label to another widget. That causes two things:

  • The label will always take the same enabled state as the buddy widget.
  • A tap on the label will focus the buddy widget.

This is the behavior of the for attribute of HTML: http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/interact/forms.html#adef-for

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Control the text alignment

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Map} Internal fallback of label size when no font is defined

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal utility to compute the content dimensions.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Firefox > 9 on OS X will draw an ellipsis on top of the label content even though there is enough space for the text. Re-applying the content forces a recalculation and fixes the problem. See qx bug #6293

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Locale change event handler

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #value}.

@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property value. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #value}.

@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param

@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.description: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Translate a plural message Mark the messages for translation. Depending on the third argument the plural or the singular form is chosen.

@param.body: singularMessageId {String} message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pluralMessageId {String} message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: count {Integer} if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.
@param.description: if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object?} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.description: The translated message or localized string
